Posts.Content:
Hi! Lisa and everyone,
I know your terror well. The fear of not knowing what to expect is, to me, a void of dark numbness that finally, is getting better. I wanted to climb in my bed and not get out. I had a routine mammogram 5/9, and a 1.3 CM Stage 1 IDC was discovered. I had a partial mastectomy and two sentinel nodes removed that were clear. I have lupus, too, and my surgeon was wonderful about
 discussing a double mastectomy with me, and reassured me that new evidence proves that in breast cancer, it's been proven best to only remove the involved tissue and only the lymph nodes they need to. Trust your dr, there are a lot of us cancer survivors worrying about
 the same thing. Hence once my dr got in there, he only needed to remove part of my rt breast to reduce the chance of impaired healing from unnecessary incision and wound size. And to my surprise, my lupus flare while waiting for surgery 6/4, seemed to abate. It's almost like my body knew the limits of what I could bear. Your dr will give you enough and powerful pain meds, take them as prescribed so you get better soonest. I found two soft pillows suited me better than the firm body pillow I had. I tuck one along my ribs on my rt side, and the second small pillow under my armpit. God bless and my prayers your way, keep us posted,
Sue
Posts.Title: Very nervous about Mastectomy surgery

Posts.Content:
Hi!
I had a partial mastectomy on June 4th. I hear your worry, I know it well. I found a wonderful plus size bra at Walmart. 9 front snaps, nylon/spandex, Fruit of the Loom, style FT308 RN 97431. I went back and got 2 more, and one in size 46 as the swelling went down a lot and I've lost a lot of weight. The sentinel lymph node scar is kinda high up near my arm pit and for the first few weeks the edge of the bra seemed to make the scar more sore, so I used a folded new white hanky to pad my stitches from the bra. I'm starting radiation treatments next week. Prayers your way,
Sue
Posts.Title: bra recommendations

Posts.Content: Please call your local health dept and ask where to get a free or income based mammogram. It's too important to put off.
Posts.Title: pain and burning sensation in left breast

Posts.Content: Hi! I'd help. No link? Is this ok with our rules?
Posts.Title: [Approved] We are designing a software product that could be helpful for breast cancer patients.
Follow up with rad onco today

Posts.Content: I an in very same situation. Same patho, 1.3 CM tumor. 33 rad tx then Arimidex. Had partial mastectomy. Had real hard time coping. Paxil is helping me immensely. Prayers her way.
Posts.Title: Mother's life, post-diagnosis

Posts.Content:
Hi!
It's so hard to hurry up and wait. Especially in a state of panic. I'm still in shock and not coping very well. With no symptoms, no family history, and 40 years of normal mammograms under my belt...they found a mass on 5/9. My biopsy on 5/16 was positive for Stage 1 invasive ductal cancer. Estrogen positive. The drs have been wonderful and reassuring. I had a breast MRI on 5/21 and a partial mastectomy on June 4th. I was expecting a lumpectomy as surgeon said study evidence shows no benefit to a mastectomy over lumpectomy with 6 weeks of full breast radiation and 5 years of arimadex. They removed the cancer completely, it was 1.3 CM and he got clear margins. They did a sentinel lymph node biopsy, removed only 2 nodes that were negative for cancer. I told surgeon it would be fine to remove both breasts, and declined any reconstruction. He reassured that there really was no evidence removing healthy tissue, with the greater post op recovery and risk for lymph edema, impacted long term survival or reoccurrence. I start radiation treatments next week. My oncotype score was 20 and oncologist said that was good and new data is showing no benefit to chemo with that score and my cancer. I feel so reassured that my treatment is being individualized for me and blessed that finally, I see some light at the end of this tunnel, this journey. I'm still so scared but grateful to have had access to the best healthcare in the world. Prayers your way,
Sue
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with DCSI...and what to do next and scared

Posts.Content:
Dear JB and everyone,
I share your fear, for sure! I had a routine mammo 5/9 and a partial mastectomy with two sentinel nodes removed on 6/4. My nodes were clear but I was having terrible indigestion and abd pain and cont to lose weight. I had put off a colonoscopy for years. In shock, I scheduled a gastroscopy and colonoscopy as instructed by my medical oncologist. I had them Wed morning. Normal colon and a hiatal hernia, not more cancer as I was convinced. So miserable can become less? 
 I can at least help you worry. I am still terrified, I have my radiation simulation and tattoo placement Wed, and start 28 treatments plus 5 'boosts' Thursday. Since I have lupus too, I'm afraid what's left of my poor boob will fry and harden. Keep us posted,
Sue
Ps I bemoaned to my surgeon that I guess I'll never be a perky size A...he laughed and said that could be arranged!
Posts.Title: Breast cancer back?

Posts.Content:
Hi! I'm in WNY and went to Elizabeth Wende clinic for my second opinion. Had my surgery at the Lipson Cancer Center in RGH. I found a similar bra on Amazon. The front hooks made it so much easier to stuff my poor swollen boob into a bra. It helped to lean forward, too. The swelling started to go down in a week. My 7 inch suture lines were actually only 4 1/2 inches. 
 I have lupus and fibro, too. I'll think of you on the 14th. Prayers your way, god bless.
Sue
Posts.Title: bra recommendations

Posts.Content:
It's certainly normal and most of us feel terrified and panicked, I think. God bless and keep us posted.
Sue
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content:
How about
 a time out? No decision until rt breast is fully healed. Set a date to reassess, like early spring. Your hubby is afraid for you and of losing you. Breast cancer effects the entire family and fear is insidious. I vote wait abit
Posts.Title: Conflict over reconstruction for symetry

Posts.Content:
I'll worry with you. I went through this in May and have 7 radiation TXs to go. 6mm isn't very large and try not to panic yet. I went to the Wende Logan Breast Clinic and had a biopsy that same day I had a repeat mamma and u/s. They tell you what they see on the spot and biopsy results in 24 hrs, or on Monday since I was there on a Friday afternoon. It was only 25 days from my abnormal mammogram till I had a partial mastectomy. I feel like I still have PTSD. So many of us, far to many of us, know how you feel. Keep us posted, hugs and prayers,
Sue
Posts.Title: Worried......

Posts.Content: Sue, 59. WNY. Mom of two, gram to 3, wife of 40 yrs. diagnosed with ER +, Stage 1A invasive ductal cancer May 16th. I had a partial mastectomy on June 4th with 2 sentinel lymph nodes removed. With no symptoms, no lump palpable, normal mammograms for 40 years, no family history, no dimpling, no changes at all....I was reeling from shock and I guess I still am. I'm trying to see the blessings through the fear. The tumor, 1.3 CM, was removed with clear margins and my lymph nodes were clear/ negative. My oncotype score was 20 and no chemo is recommended. I start arimadex and full breast radiation next week. God knows!
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
